page.title: 02TRANSPORT AND COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: This is mainly a rural area with many minor roads.The busiest road is the A137 carrying traffic from Colchester and Manningtree to Ipswich. Most of the other roads are quiet roads only used by local traffic.These roads are often narrow accommodating only one car.Lemon's Hill Bridge was built in 1980 to take traffic across the newly constructed Alton Water Reservoir.It is difficult to travel in this area unless you own a car. The only bus service here is the Eastern Counties Bus Service.The 123, 223,224 buses bring passengers from East Bergholt and beyond through Capel St.Mary, Bentley, Tattingstone and Belstead to Ipswich five times daily. Trains to London are caught from Ipswch or Manningtree.The line was electrified in 1985.
